29328.name: Credit
29328.desc: This currency, used by the Interastral Peace Corporation to settle accounts with its customers, is now widely accepted as the hard currency for space travel.
29328.lore: "People run around fighting and trading for numbers in a terminal, but the truly precious cannot be bought."

125435.name: Tracks of Destiny
125435.lore: Your victory is secured by countless failures, and the small steps you have taken led you to the turning point of fate.

151161.name: Shape Shifter's Lightning Staff
151161.desc: A wooden staff with a pointed tip. It belonged to a shape shifter from the Disciples of Sanctus Medicus. Can be used for the Ascension of Lightning characters.
151161.lore:
According to ancient Xianzhou records, those who have ascended can summon lightning and command the wind. The Disciples of Sanctus Medicus claimed to have inherited the way of the gods. By demonstrating godly power, the disciples gathered large numbers of worshipers in secret. Branches of lightning coil around this wooden staff — could it be that the disciples were indeed no mere mortals?

"The mortal body is but an illusion. Truth is only revealed to those who choose to ascend."

186254.name: Regret of Infinite Ochema
186254.lore:
No matter how many bodies it steals, its wish remains unfulfilled. Like those who seek the medicines of immortality, it craves an imperishable vessel, one that will rid it of its fear of destruction. And yet, it knows this is a dream that will never come true.

"I have seen countless worlds devoured by The Blemished One's conflagration, and I was one of THEIR flames. I danced at the twirl of THEIR fingers, keenly aware that should the fuel burn out, this fire will also extinguish..."

409960.name: Traveler's Guide
409960.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides <nobr>20,000</nobr> Character EXP.
409960.lore:
Required reading for world exploration. Press the "Read" button to tune in to an attractive voice in a language you understand, telling you about the legendary encounters of renowned adventurers across different worlds as well as the precious wisdom and knowledge that they have gathered.

"All-new series of the Traveler's Guide, The Chef's Manual to Galactic Cuisine, is now available for purchase."
"For submissions, please connect to synesthesia beacon ERD-23θ to contact an Intelligentsia Guild representative. Method of payment can be arranged to your convenience."

409961.name: Adventure Log
409961.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides <nobr>5000</nobr> Character EXP.
409961.lore:
A neatly organized collection of educational adventure notes containing countless illustrations and texts entailing adventures from beginning to end, as well as valuable information and survival-related techniques.

"Why not just digitize it and save it on a photolith disk? That'd be much more convenient."
"Advanced technology is far more fragile than you'd think when faced with stellar storms and neuron flow eruptions. Besides, I'm sure the author of this book wanted people to read it in the simplest of ways."

409962.name: Travel Encounters
409962.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides <nobr>1000</nobr> Character EXP.
409962.lore:
A travel diary with messy handwriting and random content. It's not of much use to you.

"Dan Heng, hurry up and finish reading it so you can throw it away."

549437.name: Thief's Instinct
549437.desc: A small amount of anti-matter. Crude material used for enhancement.
549437.lore:
A small amount of anti-matter that emanates out of the Voidranger: Reaver like the materialization of its destructive instinct.

"They are all looking forward to the moment of obliteration, when they will be reforged and fused with the entire world."
comeFrom: Dropped by enemies in Divergent Universe

633378.name: Usurper's Scheme
633378.desc: A moderate amount of anti-matter. Normal material used for enhancement.
633378.lore:
A moderate amount of anti-matter that floats around the Voidranger: Distorter. The amount of matter and anti-matter particles has reached a dangerous balance...

"They are all looking forward to the moment of obliteration, when they will be reforged and fused with the entire world."
comeFrom: Antimatter Legion at Equilibrium Level 2 or higher
Dropped by enemies in Divergent Universe

635669.name: Obsidian of Dread
635669.desc: A fragment of dark matter captured from the void. Used to level up Traces slightly for Nihility characters.
635669.lore:
Nothing can prove its noumenon.
Touch gently to hear an unclear murmur from the shard.

"████ ██ █ █"

717319.name: Conqueror's Will
717319.desc: Condensed anti-matter. Advanced material used for enhancement.
717319.lore:
Highly condensed anti-matter within the body of the Voidranger: Trampler. The moment of obliteration is the trumpet call for civilizations' destruction.

"They are all looking forward to the moment of obliteration, when they will be reforged and fused with the entire world."
comeFrom: Antimatter Legion at Equilibrium Level 4 or higher
Dropped by enemies in Divergent Universe

836255.name: Obsidian of Obsession
836255.desc: A sizable piece of dark matter captured from the void. Used to level up Traces significantly for Nihility characters.
836255.lore:
The weak-minded and soft-willed will spend their eternity in chaos from just a simple glance into the prism.

" "

920196.name: Obsidian of Desolation
920196.desc: A chunk of dark matter captured from the void. Used to level up Traces moderately for Nihility characters.
920196.lore:
No reflections can be seen on the surface of the black prism. Not only does it suck in all the light, it seems to also absorb the wielder's emotions, leaving only a faint feeling of emptiness.

"..."

ranks.name: Da Capo
ranks.descHash: When the Talent triggers a <u>Follow-up ATK</u>, there is a <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> <u>base chance</u> to increase the DoT received by the target by <nobr>#2[i]%</nobr> for <nobr>#3[i]</nobr> turn(s).

ranks.name: Fortississimo
ranks.descHash: While Kafka is on the field, DoT dealt by all allies increases by <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr>.

ranks.name: Capriccio
ranks.descHash:
Skill Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. 15.
Basic ATK Lv. +1, up to a maximum of Lv. 10.

ranks.name: Recitativo
ranks.descHash: When an enemy target takes DMG from the Shock status inflicted by Kafka, Kafka additionally regenerates <nobr>#1[i]</nobr> Energy.

ranks.name: Doloroso
ranks.descHash:
Ultimate Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. 15.
Talent Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. 15.

ranks.name: Leggiero
ranks.descHash: The Shock inflicted on the enemy target by the Ultimate, the Technique, or the Talent-triggered <u>Follow-up ATK</u> has a DMG multiplier increase of <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> and lasts <nobr>#2[i]</nobr> turn(s) longer.

skills.descHash: Deals Lightning DMG equal to #1[i]% of Kafka's ATK to a single enemy.
skills.name: Midnight Tumult

skills.descHash:
Deals Lightning DMG equal to #1[i]% of Kafka's ATK to a target enemy and Lightning DMG equal to #3[i]% of Kafka's ATK to enemies adjacent to it.
If the target enemy is currently receiving DoT, all DoTs currently placed on that enemy immediately produce DMG equal to #2[i]% of their original DMG.
skills.name: Caressing Moonlight

skills.descHash:
Deals Lightning DMG equal to #1[i]% of Kafka's ATK to all enemies, with a #2[i]% base chance for enemies hit to become Shocked and immediately take DMG from their current Shock state, equal to #5[i]% of its original DMG. Shock lasts for #3[i] turn(s).
While Shocked, enemies receive Lightning DoT equal to #4[i]% of Kafka's ATK at the beginning of each turn.
skills.name: Twilight Trill

skills.descHash: After Kafka's teammate uses Basic ATK on an enemy target, Kafka immediately launches Follow-up ATK and deals Lightning DMG equal to #1[i]% of her ATK to that target, with a #2[i]% base chance to inflict Shock equivalent to that applied by her Ultimate to the attacked enemy target, lasting for #3[i] turns. This effect can only be triggered 1 time per turn.
skills.name: Gentle but Cruel

skills.descHash: Attacks an enemy, and when the battle starts, reduces their Toughness of the corresponding Type.
skills.name: Attack

skills.descHash: Immediately attacks all enemies within a set range. After entering battle, deals Lightning DMG equal to #3[i]% of Kafka's ATK to all enemies, with a #1[i]% base chance to inflict Shock equivalent to that applied by her Ultimate on every enemy target for #2[i] turn(s).
skills.name: Mercy Is Not Forgiveness

embedBonusSkill.descHash: When the Ultimate is used, enemy targets will now receive DMG immediately from all currently applied DoT sources instead of just receiving DMG immediately from the currently applied Shock state.
embedBonusSkill.name: Torture

embedBonusSkill.descHash: If an enemy is defeated while Shocked, Kafka additionally regenerates <nobr>#1[i]</nobr> Energy.
embedBonusSkill.name: Plunder

embedBonusSkill.descHash: The <u>base chance</u> for target enemies to be Shocked by the Ultimate, the Technique, and the Talent-triggered <u>Follow-up ATK</u> increases by <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr>.
embedBonusSkill.name: Thorns

voiceItems.title: First Meeting
voiceItems.text: Hi, Astral Expressers... Well, you caught me.

voiceItems.title: Greeting
voiceItems.text: All space and time are practically infinite, and yet right here, right now, we find ourselves together. That's the nature of "destiny" — it creates a miracle but convinces you of an accident.

voiceItems.title: Parting
voiceItems.text: Oh, bye-bye, Trailblazer. See if you can surprise me next time.

voiceItems.title: About Self
voiceItems.text: Before I joined the Stellaron Hunters, the nature of my work meant that I barely ever saw the same person twice.

voiceItems.title: Chat: Fear
voiceItems.text: Elio said that I'm good at creating "fear," even though I don't know what it is.

voiceItems.title: Chat: Violin
voiceItems.text: Playing the violin and firing a gun both require flexible fingers, but bullets are more obedient.

voiceItems.title: Hobbies
voiceItems.text: I especially love velvet coats, they're so fragile and beautiful. Difficult to maintain — you only have to be a tiny bit careless to ruin the sheen.

voiceItems.title: Annoyances
voiceItems.text: The past and the future are so similar to each other. I'm indifferent towards them.

voiceItems.title: Something to Share
voiceItems.text: There's a planet I go to every summer to look at the sea. That's when the tides are fiercest — you have to stand far away on the shore. Then, one year, they constructed a long observation pier. I haven't been back since.

voiceItems.title: Knowledge
voiceItems.text: My home world is one of many planets changed by a Stellaron... *sigh* It's a shame I never got to witness how far it fell at the time.

voiceItems.title: About Silver Wolf
voiceItems.text: I like chatting with Silver Wolf. She's got a lot of ideas for someone so small.

voiceItems.title: About Blade
voiceItems.text: Bladie... He takes after his name — his fights are a pleasure to witness.

voiceItems.title: About Sam
voiceItems.text: Oh, Sam isn't nearly as picky about his prey as I am... you might consider it a lucky break running into me.

voiceItems.title: About Firefly
voiceItems.text: I suppose all we can do is keep each other company... for a while.

voiceItems.title: Eidolon Activation
voiceItems.text: No one can completely grasp another's thoughts... Not even you or I.

voiceItems.title: Character Ascension
voiceItems.text: If destiny can't propel me forward, I'll be the one to push destiny.

voiceItems.title: Max Level Reached
voiceItems.text: It's tough to get going again once you've stopped, don't you think?

voiceItems.title: Trace Activation
voiceItems.text: The path to the future begins right here.

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Trailblazer
voiceItems.text: Trailblazer, we meet again.

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Silver Wolf
voiceItems.text: Let's skip the formalities, Silver Wolf. I'm always game for putting on a show.

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Blade
voiceItems.text: The hunt beckons, Bladie. Are you ready?

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Himeko
voiceItems.text: Oh, the Express Crew. Looks like we'll be joining forces quite often, huh?

voiceItems.title: Added to Team With Firefly
voiceItems.text: It's not in the script, so what happens next is up to us.

voiceItems.title: Battle Begins: Weakness Break
voiceItems.text: Caught in the net.

voiceItems.title: Battle Begins: Danger Alert
voiceItems.text: Just in time.

voiceItems.title: Turn Begins 1
voiceItems.text: May as well kill them all~

voiceItems.title: Turn Begins 2
voiceItems.text: That breathing sensation? Remember it.

voiceItems.title: Turn Idling
voiceItems.text: Time to move.

voiceItems.title: Basic ATK
voiceItems.text: This won't take long.

voiceItems.title: Hit by Light Attack
voiceItems.text: Didn't hurt.

voiceItems.title: Hit by Heavy Attack
voiceItems.text: Not bad.

voiceItems.title: Ultimate: Activate
voiceItems.text: Good times never last.

voiceItems.title: Ultimate: Unleash
voiceItems.text: Time to say bye. BOOM.

voiceItems.title: Talent 1
voiceItems.text: Relax.

voiceItems.title: Talent 2
voiceItems.text: Stand still.

voiceItems.title: Downed
voiceItems.text: This... isn't the end.

voiceItems.title: Return to Battle
voiceItems.text: Oh! I'm still alive.

voiceItems.title: Health Recovery
voiceItems.text: Thanks. You're too good to me.

voiceItems.title: Technique
voiceItems.text: Does that hurt?

voiceItems.title: Battle Won
voiceItems.text: The human body is beautiful in its fragility.

voiceItems.title: Treasure Opening 1
voiceItems.text: Hmm. We can use it.

voiceItems.title: Treasure Opening 2
voiceItems.text: No surprise there.

voiceItems.title: Precious Treasure Opening
voiceItems.text: Like what you see? Me too.

voiceItems.title: Successful Puzzle-Solving 1
voiceItems.text: Nice work.

voiceItems.title: Successful Puzzle-Solving 2
voiceItems.text: Impressive. Want a prize?

voiceItems.title: Enemy Target Found
voiceItems.text: Huh, they don't look happy to see us...

voiceItems.title: Returning to Town
voiceItems.text: *sigh* Is that a stain? I like this coat.

storyItems.title: Character Details
storyItems.text: On the Interastral Peace Corporation's wanted list, Kafka's record only shows her name and a note about her "interest in collecting coats." Little is known about this Stellaron Hunter aside from her being one of "Destiny's Slave" Elio's most trusted members. In order to achieve Elio's envisioned future, Kafka gets to work.

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part I
storyItems.text:
"Kafka, female human. Hails from New Babylon of Pteruges-V. Core member of the Stellaron Hunters, the next-in-command of 'Destiny's Slave.' Responsible for the following infractions: The Pier Point Incursion, two counts; The Pier Point Heist; The Trovys Disappearance; The Stellaron events of Jemorse, Bayjhana, Shilla-39C, Ulmora, 7-Midville, Loar-51, and Dro'a; Cyber attacks against Pier Point, four counts; Cyber attacks against Planet Screwllum; Cyber attacks against Herta Space Station; The Jepella Rebellion. Suspected to be related to the following infractions: The Stellaron events of Sich-Lala, Inupeis, Oun-G7, Zukov, Lidovia, Illily, Attouine, Buhayama.
Wanted Level: Highest. Dead or alive."
— Wanted Order by the Interastral Peace Corporation

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part II
storyItems.text:
"...Due to the investigation's needs, the suspect's basic information is published as follows: Suspect Kafka (Wanted Serial No.: L933012000020002010004), female, outworld individual, age unknown; height about 170 centimeters, average body size. She had been spotted draped with a black jacket and wearing a white collared shirt inside, a pair of tight-fitting dark shorts, purple pantyhose, and a pair of sunglasses on her head.
The suspect has been reported to be connected to multiple non-natural disasters occurring on the Luofu in the recent past. She is currently at large, and is now publicly wanted on the Luofu. Any department and unit who detected said suspect are encouraged to contact the local Cloud Knights. At the same time, we encourage the suspect to turn herself in and to not take any chances."
— Luofu Wanted Order (revoked)

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part III
storyItems.text:
"...This woman's name is Kafka, a new Hunter without any information on file, and belongs to no particular organization. She has an ability called Spirit Whisper that allows her to hypnotically manipulate others through language. Recently, she has appeared in Riverland, New Babylon. She was seen communicating with its overchief, Shilde, and absconded with him in witness of 143 people. She then made an appearance at a clothing store and stole a black jacket, two white shirts, and a red dress with 6 witnesses. After that, she was seen by 28 people at an old music record store where she purchased nothing. Before she emerged at the Riverland Guard Station to claim her rewards, she was spotted at the central park with 2695 citizens present. We want Kafka's head, as her lethal crimes cannot go unpunished."
— Wanted Order by the Pteruges-V Devils

storyItems.title: Character Story: Part IV
storyItems.text:
"...Go to Pteruges-V and locate an abandoned building at coordinates 135:7372124, 271:6372711. Enter it. There is an untouched canned drink under the window sill on the first floor. Take it. Wait until 11:12 AM on Wednesday and place the can at the entrance of the building. Kafka will appear 2 minutes later. There is a chance she will stop to investigate the can. Then, take the chance to throw this ball at her feet. I will take over and converse with her from there.
There is also a chance that Kafka will ignore the can. In that case, just throw the ball away. You will die, but death will come for everyone. As for the future that you yearn for - I will realize it."
— Wanted Order by Destiny's Slave

name: Kafka
descHash: A member of the Stellaron Hunters. A dashing, collected, and professional beauty. Used the enchantment of Spirit Whisper to set up Trailblazer to absorb the Stellaron. Her hobby is shopping for and organizing her collection of coats.
